info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued March 27 at 10:46PM CDT until March 28 at 12:30AM CDT by NWS Brownsville TX
info.description:
At 1046 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 4 and 8 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 3 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly.
HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding.
SOURCE...Radar.
IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses.
Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Harlingen, San Benito, Los Fresnos, Rancho Viejo, Rio Hondo, Laureles, Arroyo City, Olmito, Brownsville, Lozano, Palmer Laasko Elementary, Library Memorial Middle School, Rio Hondo High School, Los Fresnos High School, Lopez - Riggins Elementary School, Los Fresnos City Offices, Resaca Middle School, Rio Hondo Junior High School, Los Cuates and Rio Hondo Elementary School.
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
Stay away or be swept away. River banks and culverts can become unstable and unsafe.
